titleStmt.title: The kingly myrrour, or King Charles his last legacy to the prince his son. Written a little before his death. Containing many excellent instructions and directions, how to carry himselfe in all estates and conditions. And may serve as a good monitor for all the princes in Christendome.
titleStmt.author: Gauden, John, 1605-1662.
Charles I, King of England, 1600-1649, attributed name.

notesStmt.note: Authorship of the Eikon basilike was originally attributed to Charles I, but according to Madan (pp. 125-33) it was written by John Gauden who probably included some authentic writings of the king.
This is a reprint of chapter 27 of the Eikon. The printer is unknown and the initials C.V. in imprint are probably an invention. -- Madan.
Reproduction of the original in the British Library.
